Description: describes the capability to provide concrete functions
describes the ability of at least two software components to exchange information and/or to perform their required functions while sharing a hardware or software environment
describes the degree to which software can be transferred from one environment to another
is concerned with the effort that is needed to use the ontology by stated or implied users
describes the capability of ontologies to be modified for changing environments, requirements, or functional specifications
measures how a product used by specific users meets their needs to achieve their goals. It is the quality in a particular context of use
describes the relationship between software performance and resource consumption under stated conditions
is concerned with maintaining the level of performance under the stated conditions
